books.title: Black Beauty
books.author: Anna Sewell
books.summary: A memoir narrated by a horse whose idyllic time on an English farm prepares him for a life filled with constant change and varied circumstances.

books.title: The Man in the Brown Suit
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: Anne Beddingfeld travels to South Africa after finding a cryptic note beside the body of a man whose death she witnessed in the London Underground.

books.title: Our Nig
books.author: Harriet E. Wilson
books.summary: An autobiographical account of a young biracial girl abandoned by her parents and forced into servitude in the northern United States.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: The Coral Island
books.author: R. M. Ballantyne
books.summary: Three shipwrecked youths encounter delights and dangers as they attempt to escape their uninhabited tropical island paradise.

books.title: Kipps
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: An orphan raised by his aunt and uncle struggles as a young man to integrate into upper class society after receiving a substantial inheritance from his grandfather.

books.title: Oedipus Rex
books.author: Sophocles
books.summary: A king tries to save his citizens from a devastating plague.

books.title: The Wonderful Visit
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: An angel falls into the everyday world of 19th Century England and is bewildered and despirited by human life and society.

books.title: His Last Bow
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his faithful biographer tackle more mysterious cases.

books.title: The Vampire
books.author: John William Polidori
books.summary: A London gentleman goes on an ill-fated trip with a mysterious and sinister newcomer.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.

books.title: The Paradise Mystery
books.author: J. S. Fletcher
books.summary: A young doctor attempts to turn a mysterious death to his romantic advantage.

books.title: The Cruise of the Alerte
books.author: E. F. Knight
books.summary: An English journalist sets sail in search of treasure buried on a remote desert island.

books.title: A Pluralistic Universe
books.author: William James
books.summary: A philosopher gives an introduction to radical empiricism and how it relates to the experienced world.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: Evelina
books.author: Fanny Burney
books.summary: A young woman navigates the absurdities of 18th-century English society, fends off various suitors, and attempts to establish her true parentage.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Poul Anderson
books.summary: A collection of science fiction short stories by Poul Anderson ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Herman Melville
books.summary: A collection of Herman Melville’s short stories, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Tao Te Ching
books.author: Laozi
books.summary: One of the fundamental texts of the Tao philosophy and religion.

books.title: My Four Weeks in France
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A sports columnist and humorist travels to France as a war correspondent during World War I and recounts his experiences on the assignment.
